knowledge_child_item_header_0: Usa WiFi para ver y subir videos

knowledge_child_item_header_6: Ajusta - Usar menos datos - en Instagram

knowledge_child_item_header_8: Desactiva la actualizaci√≥n autom√°tica de las aplicaciones
knowledge_child_item_content_0: Las im√°genes en movimiento usan la mayor√≠a de los datos. Ten cuidado de no ver demasiados videos o subir videos en diferentes aplicaciones, para ahorrar tus datos m√≥viles.
knowledge_child_item_content_1: Muchos servicios de streaming como Netflix y SVT PLAY te ofrecen autom√°ticamente la mejor calidad de video posible, independientemente de que estes sentado frente a un gran televisor o una peque√±a pantalla de celular. Pero una baja calidad suele ser suficiente en tu tel√©fono m√≥vil, por lo que puede ser inteligente elegir una baja calidad para hacer que tus datos duren m√°s.
knowledge_child_item_content_2: Muchas aplicaciones usan tus datos m√≥viles sin que te des cuenta. Ve a ‚ÄùConfiguraci√≥n‚Äù en tu tel√©fono. En Android selecciona luego ‚ÄùUso de Datos‚Äù donde puedes hacer clic en cada aplicaci√≥n y seleccionar ‚ÄùRestringir datos de fondo‚Äù. En iPhone, selecciona ‚ÄùDatos M√≥viles‚Äù para poder desactivar los datos m√≥viles para las distintas aplicaciones ‚ÄùUsar datos m√≥viles para‚Äù.
knowledge_child_item_content_3: Si desactivas la actualizaci√≥n de 2do plano, una aplicaci√≥n solo usa datos m√≥viles cuando la estas usando realmente, lo cual aumenta la vida de tu bater√≠a. Ve a ‚ÄùConfigiraci√≥n‚Äù en tu tel√©fono. En Android selecciona luego ‚ÄùUso de datos‚Äù. En iPhone, selecciona ‚ÄùGeneral‚Äù y luego ‚ÄùActualizaci√≥n de 2do plano‚Äù.
knowledge_child_item_content_4: Si quieres ahorrar en tus datos m√≥viles cuando escuchas Spotify, puedes seleccionar ‚ÄùDescargar‚Äù para las canciones y listas de reproducci√≥n que escuchas con frecuencia; haz esto cuando tienes WiFi. Las m√∫sica descargada no usa nada de datos m√≥viles y puedes hacer lo mismo con muchos videos y clips.
knowledge_child_item_content_5: Las conversaciones con video como Skype usan muchos datos. Olv√≠date de Skype y en su lugar realiza llamadas telef√≥nicas normales o usa Skype cuando estes conectado a WiFi. ¬°Esto te ahorrar√° una gran cantidad de datos!
knowledge_child_item_content_6: Instagram puede utilizar bastantes datos, lo cual es algo en lo que seguramente no piensas. En ‚ÄùAjustes‚Äù y luego ‚ÄùUso de datos m√≥viles‚Äù en la aplicaci√≥n puedes seleccionar ‚ÄùUsar menos datos‚Äù.
knowledge_child_item_content_7: Los videos en Facebook que se reproducen autom√°ticamente en tu secci√≥n de noticias usan m√°s datos de lo que puedes pensar. En ajustes en la aplicaci√≥n Facebook puedes seleccionar que solo se reproduzcan los videos autom√°ticamente cuando estes navegando con WiFi.
knowledge_child_item_content_8: En ajustes de tu tel√©fono usualmente puedes seleccionar una alternativa que haga que tu tel√©fono solo descargue actualizaciones autom√°ticas para tus aplicaciones cuando est√°s conectado a WiFi. ¬°Cada descarga puede no ser muy grande, pero si tus aplicaciones se actualizan a menudo, esto puede comerse el lote completo de tus datos!

parent_advice_title_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do I teach my children about the importance of money?
parent_advice_content_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Give your children freedom to decide on their own money! When you use Gimi, the children can keep track of how much money they have. If you buy something, consider taking it out from the piggy bank and if your child wants to buy something for which the money in the piggy bank isn't enough, well, let your child save up for it. In this way, your child learns that their purchase decisions, savings and services have an impact on what they get in the end! If you want to learn more, you can read more good tips on our website.
parent_advice_title_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE When should I begin giving out a weekly or monthly allowance?
parent_advice_content_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is common for children to begin receiving a weekly allowance when they are 6-7 years old and most go over to a monthly allowance when they are around 11 years old. But you can feel what is best for you and your child! Still, it is good to start early and you can begin with different types of reward even before you begin giving out a weekly allowance. For example, you can reward your child with candy on Saturdays if they brush their teeth regularly.
parent_advice_title_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why is it good to have an interest rate in the piggy bank?
parent_advice_content_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Giving children an interest rate is a way to teach how saving money works in adult life. The money that you save, well, they grow and become more money. Setting an interest rate in the piggy bank in order to teach this good conduct at an early age is good and is a knowledge that your children can take with them into adult life.
parent_advice_title_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE When should my children get their first bank card?
parent_advice_content_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Giving a bank card to your child can be seen as a great step. Because all of a sudden your child can spend money without you parents' company. But if you provide them with a card, your children will also be able to make their own purchase decisions and be more responsible for their money. Only you as a parent can decide when this is appropriate, but many children nowadays get their bank card around 10 years of age.
parent_advice_title_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE How much should my child get as a weekly of monthly allowance?
parent_advice_content_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE It depends on what you agree that the child should use the money for. Make sure that it is enough for them to be able to buy what you have agreed on and a little bit more for saving. So you have set a solid basis. And don't forget, the most important thing isn't the amount they get, but how the money is spent and how the child learns to handle money. For this reason it is good to talk about different purchases, who pays for what and that you as parents make sure that the children get their money so that they can make their own purchase decisions.
parent_advice_title_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do we use the app if we are separated parents?
parent_advice_content_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE Gimi is developing features so that you as separated parents can be able to handle the child's money together. But right now the easiest thing to do is to set up an account for the child and agree on giving out a weekly allowance every week. The alternative is that the child sets up an account with each parent, and therefore has two accounts. But we understand that this is not perfect, so we are working on it!
parent_advice_title_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE What should I do when the child meets a savings goal?
parent_advice_content_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is important that you give out the money for the savings goal or that you, together with your child, buy the thing that the child was saving up for. In this way, the child's savings become real and the child learns that it pays off to save up for something that they really want to have!
parent_advice_title_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE Should I decide what the children should be able to buy with their money?
parent_advice_content_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is good to talk about what the weekly or monthly allowance should cover so that your children know what they should pay for themselves. But it is important that your children can decide what they will buy with their own money. So they can learn to make wrong purchases and learn from their mistakes, which is a good lesson for life!
parent_advice_title_9: PLZ_TRANSLATE What should my children get as an interest rate?
parent_advice_content_9: PLZ_TRANSLATE It depends on how you as a parent want to motivate them to saving. A child who has a hard time reaching the savings goal might need a little higher interest rate, while others might have a lower one if they are good at saving. But this is a good lesson that saved money grow, this is how it works when you grow up. He who saves, has!
parent_advice_title_10: PLZ_TRANSLATE How much should I reward my children when they complete chores?
parent_advice_content_10: PLZ_TRANSLATE You should try to adapt the amount you choose to give as a reward to how much money your child has, to how difficult the chore is and how important its completion is to you. But keep in mind that this is about lessons and that your child should be motivated to earn their own money and help out around the house. And don't forget, a hug or a thank you often mean more than a reward in money!
parent_advice_title_11: PLZ_TRANSLATE What does it mean that ‚Äùunpaid allowance is automatically saved‚Äù?
parent_advice_content_11: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is difficult to give out a weekly or monthly allowance in time and we don't always have money on us so that the children can get their money. If you choose that ‚Äùunpaid allowance‚Äù is automatically saved under settings, then the amount that wasn't paid in time is automatically put in the piggy bank. So the children get their weekly or monthly allowance in the piggy bank and you, instead, can give out the money when they must buy something. Then you can just choose to withdraw from the piggy bank!
child_advice_title_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE How can I get a higher weekly or monthly allowance?
child_advice_content_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE In order for you to get a higher weekly or monthly allowance, we have some smart tips here! 1. If you want to get a higher allowance, explain why and what you would do with the money. It isn't so smart to ask for an allowance raise to buy more candy, think instead about what good things you need money for, for example your bus card. 2. Negotiate at a good time. Don't do it when you have to buy something, but rather when you are at home at the dinner table. It is extra good if you negotiate when you have a birthday. Because when you become older you can ask for more money, because you can be more responsible. 3. The best way to get a raise is to ask your parents what you can help with or what you can do to earn some extra money. Ask your parents to insert it as a chore in the app, so that you really get the money when the chore is completed.
child_advice_title_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE What is an interest rate?
child_advice_content_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE Your interest rate is given in something called percent and it works so that when you save money you receive a savings bonus, just because you have saved your money. The more you have saved, the more you get as a bonus. And the higher the interest rate is, the more you get as a bonus too. So if you have gotten an interest rate from your parents and you save money, your saved money will grow!
child_advice_title_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE How does my piggy bank work?
child_advice_content_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE In your piggy bank you can save your money. You can, for example, save up your weekly allowance, when you get a reward for a chore or as a deposit that your parents can make. When you have bought something that your parents have paid for, you can take out the money from the piggy bank or if you want take out your money you can ask your parents for a payment, for example if you meet a savings goal and you want to take out your money to buy what you have been saving for.
child_advice_title_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE How does the weekly or monthly allowance that I will get work?
child_advice_content_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Your weekly or monthly allowance is decided by your parents and you will receive it once per week or per month. You can choose to save your allowance in the piggy bank, but you can also ask your parents to pay it out in cash the day you have agreed on. Keep in mind that you don't get any savings bonus for the money in your allowance, so sometimes it can be smart to save it in the piggy bank even before you receive it.
child_advice_title_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do I get my money out from the app?
child_advice_content_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can ask your parents to give you your weekly or monthly allowance in cash. But you can also let your piggy bank work as your wallet, so when you and your parents are shopping you can use the money in the piggy bank by having your parents pay for you. So then they can take out the money from your piggy bank by making a withdraw in the app.
child_advice_title_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE Who can I connect with?
child_advice_content_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can just connect with your parents. This is so that no-one else can know how much money you have. You can connect with more than one parent. Just go to your settings and choose to invite one more parent.
child_advice_title_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do I accomplish a chore?
child_advice_content_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE Your parents assign chores to you. If you don't have any, you can ask for chores, and go on to discuss what you should do in order to complete the chores. When you have been assigned a chore, you can click on the chore to complete it. Keep in mind that some chores require you to give photo evidence, and some chores are on a  ‚Äùfirst come first served‚Äù basis so you must be faster than any of your siblings in completing it.
child_advice_title_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why should I set up a savings goal?
child_advice_content_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is always good to set up a goal for what you want to save up for. You can always change your savings goal along the way. But if you have a savings goal it is easier for you to see how your money grows and how you get closer to the amount you are saving up. When you meet the savings goal you should ask your parents to give you your money so that you can buy what you've been saving for!
child_advice_title_9: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do I join Gimi's Kids Council?
child_advice_content_9: PLZ_TRANSLATE Gimi's Council is made up of children who want to help make the app better.  We meet once a month and have fun meetings about the app and how we can make videos and so on. You can join by sending an e-mail to philip@veckopengen.se! Write your age, your name and why you'd like to join Barnr√•det! We hope to hear from you!
parent_about_data_tracking_title_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why don't I see any data on the meter?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you notice that your child's surfing is not being measured, you can check any of the following cases: 1) Check that your child hasn't turned off the background app refresh in the settings for our app, because then the surfing can't be measured. 2) Check that your child isn't only surfing on WiFi. 3) If your child has an old phone, perhaps it isn't supported by our service so unfortunately the measuring will not work for you.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why does the child's data amount change suddenly?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE If your child logs in with another phone or hasn't been in the app for a long time, then it will change suddenly.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is anything other than the amount of data measured?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, we only track the data amount and we just show individual data within the family, which means those who are connected in the app. It is very important to us to keep your data safe and that you as a family feel comfortable with our functions. You can always read more in our Terms of use where we explain how we handle data.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Does it count even when my child is surfing on WiFi?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, since the costs for WiFi surfing aren't connected to how much someone surfs with their mobile plan we have decided not to count that.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE What does Telenor have to do with Gimi?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE Telenor is an expert in how people surf on their phone and they have given good tips that you can find in the app. We and Telenor simply want to help teach children to surf smart and economize their mobile surfing.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why can't I set up a surf pot?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you aren't connected with your child you can't give out a surf pot. If we can't see that your child is using any mobile data, you can't do that either. But please try again after a while, because it can take some time before we can see data coming in about your child's surfing. If your child has an old phone, perhaps it isn't supported by our service so unfortunately the measuring will not work for you.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE How well is the data amount measured?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_7: PLZ_TRANSLATE We try to measure the data as well as possible. But for Android phones we can't measure data unless the child logs into the app. So for those who have Android, sometimes the data can be updated worse.
parent_about_data_tracking_title_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE How much surfing is normal/good for my children?
parent_about_data_tracking_content_8: PLZ_TRANSLATE We at Gimi don't give any evaluation as to how much data your children use. But we think that it is important, within the family, to agree on a reasonable amount and that the children learn to economize.
child_about_data_tracking_title_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why don't I see any data on the meter?
child_about_data_tracking_content_1: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you notice that your surfing is not being measured, you can check any of the following cases: 1) Check that you haven't turned off the background app refresh in the settings for our app, because then the surfing can't be measured. 2) Check that you aren't only surfing on WiFi. 3) It can also be that you have old phone that isn't supported by our service so unfortunately the measuring will not work for you.
child_about_data_tracking_title_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why does the my data amount change suddenly?
child_about_data_tracking_content_2: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you log in with another phone or haven't been in the app for a long time, then it will change suddenly.
child_about_data_tracking_title_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is anything other than how much I surf measured?
child_about_data_tracking_content_3: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, we only track the data amount and we just show individual data within the family, which means those who are connected in the app. It is very important to us to keep your data safe and that you as a family feel comfortable with our functions. You can always read more in our Terms of use where we explain how we handle data.
child_about_data_tracking_title_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Does it count even when I am surfing on WiFi?
child_about_data_tracking_content_4: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, since the costs for WiFi surfing aren't connected to how much you surf with your mobile plan we have decided not to count that.
child_about_data_tracking_title_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE What does Telenor have to do with Gimi?
child_about_data_tracking_content_5: PLZ_TRANSLATE Telenor is an expert in how people surf on their phone and they have given good tips that you can find in the app. We and Telenor simply want to help teach you to surf smart and economize your mobile surfing.
child_about_data_tracking_title_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE How well is the data amount measured?
child_about_data_tracking_content_6: PLZ_TRANSLATE We try to measure the data as well as possible. But for Android phones we can't measure data unless you log into the app. So for you as an Android user, sometimes the data can be updated worse and so it can be smart to log into the app every Sunday to see how you're doing with your surfing.
